title: Android 13 Beta 3 will bring native support for braille displays
content:
Over the years, Google has added many features to Android to make the operating system more accessible to people with special needs. For instance, Andriod 10 brought Live Caption and Live Transcribe, while Android 12 added a new feature called Camera Switches, allowingÂ users to control their phones with facial expressions. As part of this continued

The post Android 13 Beta 3 will bring native support for braille displays appeared first on XDA.
description: The upcoming Android 13 beta will bring native support for braille displays, allowing deafblind users to more easily access their smartphones.
